cards.title: Legion
setup: At the start of the game, {Legion} enters play �Nanotech Master Criminal� side up.
Put {H} �Nanite Swarm� cards under this card. Remove the{br}rest from the game. Set {Legion}'s HP to {10 * H}
gameplay: At the end of the villain turn, {Legion} deals the hero with the most equipment cards in play {H - 1} melee damage. If a hero takes damage this way, destroy one of their equipment cards.
When a Nanite Swarm would enter play, place it under this card.
When {Legion} flips to this side, restore him to an amount of health equal to the number of cards under this card times 10.
When {Legion} would be reduced to 0 HP or less, flip this card.
Legion is indestructible so long as there are any cards under this card
cards.advanced: Increase damage dealt by villain targets by 1.
flippedGameplay: When {Legion} flips to this side, put all cards under {Legion} into play.
After a Nanite Swarm is destroyed, remove it from the game and put all other Nanite Swarms from play under this card, then {Legion} flips.
cards.flippedAdvanced: Reduce damage dealt to villain targets by 1.
challengeText: Nanite Swarms are not removed from the game when destroyed. Instead of removing leftover nanite swarms from the game in setup, shuffle them into the villain deck.

openingLines.default: That's some nice tech you've got there. It'd be a shame if it were to... disappear.
openingLines.GuardiansOfTomorrow.HopliteCharacter: I am Legion, for we are many!
openingLines.GuardiansOfTomorrowHopliteCharacter: You've resisted for the last time! Your inventions will be MINE!

cards.title: Nanite Swarm
cards.body: At the end of the villain turn, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP 2 melee damage and gains 2 HP.
cards.flavorText: There's too many of them! We have to cut{br}them off at the source!

cards.title: Constructed Plasma Turret
body: At the end of the villain turn, this card deals the hero target with the second lowest HP {H - 1} energy damage.
cards.flavorText: That's an interesting design. Could probably incorporate that into a drone...

cards.title: Nanite Trap
cards.body: When this card takes damage, it deals the source of that damage 2 melee damage. Targets dealt damage this way cannot deal damage until the start of the villain turn.

cards.title: Hacked Vault Door
cards.body: This card's maximum HP is {2 * H}. Reduce damage taken by this card to 1. Redirect all damage dealt to villain targets to this card. At the end of any hero turn, players may discard any number of cards. If they do, this card deals itself irreducible energy damage equal to the number of cards discarded this way.
cards.flavorText: Sealed so tightly not even I could get in{br}or out. Enjoy yourselves, heroes, until{br}your air runs out!

cards.title: Lethal Ambush
cards.body: {Legion} deals the hero target with the lowest HP {H} energy damage, or {H + 2} energy damage if they have 10 or less HP remaining.
cards.flavorText: What're you doing over here all alone?

cards.title: Devour Tech
cards.body: Destroy a hero equipment card. If a card is destroyed this way, play the top 2 cards of the villain deck.
cards.flavorText: Any metal he touches, he can turn into{br}more of himself!

cards.title: Creeping Assault
cards.body: {Legion} deals the hero with the highest HP {H} projectile damage. That hero's player discards 2 cards.

flavorQuotes.text: I see you're behind me now.
How do you see anything with that blindfold on?

cards.title: Hungry Nanoblades
cards.body: {Legion} deals each hero target 2 irreducible melee damage. Increase damage dealt to those targets by 1 until the end of the next villain turn.
cards.flavorText: Those blades can chew through any{br}armor! Watch out!

cards.title: Prey on Weakness
cards.body: Destroy {H - 1} hero ongoing cards. {Legion} deals each hero without any ongoing cards in play {H} energy damage.
cards.flavorText: I am mechanical perfection! You are just{br}flawed organics!

cards.title: Nanite Barrage
cards.body: {Legion} deals the hero target with the second highest HP projectile damage equal to the number of Devices in play plus 2.
